summary: This is a July 2, 2020, press release from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York announcing the arrest and indictment of Ghislaine Maxwell. It charges her with conspiracy with Jeffrey Epstein to sexually abuse minors, enticement, transportation of minors for illegal sexual activity, and perjury related to 2016 depositions. The document details the alleged grooming and abuse scheme spanning from 1994 to 1997.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Arrested and charged with conspiring with Jeffrey Epstein to sexually abuse minors, enticement, transportation, and perjury. Alleged to have played a critical role in grooming and abusing victims.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Deceased financier with whom Maxwell allegedly conspired to sexually abuse minor girls. Described as having a preference for young girls.

persons.name: Audrey Strauss
persons.role: Acting United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York
persons.context: Issued the press release and made a statement detailing Maxwell's alleged role in facilitating and participating in the sexual abuse of minors.

persons.name: William F. Sweeney Jr.
persons.role: Assistant Director-in-Charge of the New York Field Office of the FBI
persons.context: Made a statement commending the victims for their bravery and describing Maxwell's alleged disregard for the law in luring vulnerable youth.

persons.name: Dermot Shea
persons.role: Commissioner of the New York City Police Department (NYPD)
persons.context: Made a statement condemning the alleged crimes and commending investigators for their commitment to justice for survivors.

persons.name: Alison J. Nathan
persons.context: The judge to whom Maxwell's case is assigned.

persons.name: Nicholas Blase
persons.role: Sender of the original press release (USANYS)
persons.context: The individual from the U.S. Attorney's Office who initially sent the press release email.

connections.description: Alleged to have conspired together to sexually abuse minor girls, with Maxwell recruiting, grooming, and facilitating access to victims for Epstein.
Alleged to have befriended, groomed, and participated in the sexual abuse of minor victims, some as young as 14.
Alleged to have sexually abused minor girls, with acts including sexualized massages and other sexual contact.
Strauss, as Acting U.S. Attorney, is leading the prosecution office that brought the charges against Maxwell.

events.title: Arrest of Ghislaine Maxwell
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell was arrested and charged in a Manhattan federal court with conspiracy, enticement, transportation of minors for illegal sex acts, and perjury.

events.title: Period of Alleged Abuse Conspiracy
events.description: The indictment alleges Maxwell and Epstein conspired to sexually abuse minor girls, with victims as young as 14, during this period.

events.title: Maxwell's False Deposition Testimony
events.description: Maxwell is charged with perjury for making false statements under oath during depositions in a 2016 civil proceeding.

locations: New Hampshire (where Maxwell was to be presented in court)
keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell was arrested on July 2, 2020, and charged with conspiring with Jeffrey Epstein to sexually abuse minors.
The alleged criminal conspiracy took place from at least 1994 to 1997, involving victims as young as 14 years old.
Maxwell is accused of playing a critical role in recruiting, grooming, and facilitating the abuse of minors, sometimes being present during sex acts.
Abuse allegedly occurred at Epstein's residences in New York, Florida, and New Mexico, as well as Maxwell's residence in London.
Maxwell faces additional charges of perjury for false statements made under oath during 2016 depositions.
